Pre-Game Insights: The Padres hold a 1-0 series lead heading into Game 2 of the NL Wild Card against the Atlanta Braves.
Joe Musgrove will take the mound for San Diego, while Atlanta will counter with left-hander Max Fried.
The Padres are slight favorites at -120, while the Braves are +120 underdogs.
Others: The Padres' offense has been led by Manny Machado, who hit 29 home runs with 105 RBIs, and Luis Arraez, who posted a.318 average.
Max Fried had an 11-10 record during the regular season, along with a stellar 3.25 ERA and 1.16 WHIP.
Joe Musgrove had a solid regular season, going 6-5 with a 3.88 ERA and 1.17 WHIP over 126 innings.
